intro: Humiria balsamifera var. savannarum, commonly known as the savanna balsam, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as savannas and forest edges. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in local herbal remedies.
